bibl.title: Letter from Aristides Agramonte to the Surgeon General, August 13, 1902

div1.p: Agramonte forwards his contract of annulment with the U. S. Army and discusses reimbursement for mileage traveled since annulment. He also requests a certificate of non-indebtedness.

div1.head: Letter from Aristides Agramonte to the Surgeon General, August 13, 1902
div1.opener:
OFFICE OF SURGEON GENERAL
AUG 16
38657
Z
1902
WAR DEPARTMENT
144 H. 79th St.,
New York City,
Aug. 15, 1902.
Aristides Agramonte
Cont. Surg.
Forwards his contract
for annulment. Also
encloses accounts for
mileage and requests
that they be forwarded
to the proper Paymaster.
Requests a cert. of non-
indebtedness.
6 encls.
#144 Co. 79th street
New York Aug 13 1902
To the Surgeon General U. S. Army
Washington
D.C.
Sir:
div1.p:
I have the honor to enclose my
Contract for annulment on the 15th
inst. date on which my leave of
absence will be due, as per S.O. 101 p. 10
Headquarters of the Army Washington Apr 29 1902
and S.O. 102 Hdqtrs. Dept. of Cuba, Havana May
10th 1902.

I also enclose mileage account for my
return home as per Contract, viz; “at the
“ expiration of his term of service, the said Dr
“ Aristides Agramonte shall receive travelling allow-
“ ances as aforesaid, for actual travel only to
“ New York” etc.- which account I beg be for-
warded to the proper Paymaster for
settlement, after duly endorsed.

The second contract of the two enclosed
was granted by Surg. Gen. Sternberg for the
purpose of allowing me the priviledge
of the “leave of absence” clause not on the
first contract, therefore I would beg that
you endorse upon this Contract of Sept
1 1900 that it was issued in substitution
of the one annulled Aug. 31 1900.

At the same time, with the contracts,
I would request that you send me a
certificate of non-indebtedness.
div1.closer:
Very respectfully Aristides Agramonte Cont. Surgeon
U. S. Army
